author: Wyckednite
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2020
review_content: I bought the Black/Green, size 9 - 10 and I waited a few weeks after buying the slippers to write this review.My star rating:+ 4 stars for the slipper overall.- 1 star for the size being off.These ARE very nice slippers but the size is off.Being the pattern freak that I am, my habit is to read a lot of the critical reviews to see if a pattern of the same complaint emerges.  If the same complaint is mentioned over and over in different reviews, it doesn't really stop me from purchasing. It just helps me make adjustments in my purchase (if that makes sense?).So saying: Do yourself a favor and read multiple critical reviews before buying.  Had I taken the time to read the reviews before I clicked on BUY on these slippers, I'd have bought one size larger than my usual.My review:PROs:* The inside sole is very, very cushy.* The bottom sole is the same as my slip-on tennies.  It's a firm, hard, rubber-type material with excellent traction; making it far less likely for you to slip on slick flooring or a wet spot on the floor.I wouldn't recommend tromping through mud or going on a hike while wearing them but, you could easily wear them to pop into the store for some late night snacks (I might have done this once or twice. Maybe.).* The material the slipper itself is made of is thick and soft; making me believe the slippers will last a good while (if you don't wear them to pop into the store EVERY night).* The material that covers the outside of the slipper has tiny ridges and looks like it would repel liquid if you spilled something on them though I haven't tested this theory.* The colors--inside and out--are bright. I chose the neon green/black and the colors are very pretty.  Although the neon green looks more neon yellow-ish than green, to me.CON:  I've only found one CON but I'll explain in as much detail as I can here; in hopes that it helps you decide what size to buy.*  The size is not a true fit.  I wear a size 12 women's which translates to a size 10 men's.Size 12 in women's shoes is difficult to find so I have most always just bought men's shoes when it comes to slippers, flip flops or boat shoes.  Size 9 or 10 in men's has ALWAYS fit well, if not just a tad loose when I buy a size 10.So I thought (assumed...) these slippers in size 9 - 10 would be just right.  Wrong!  These slippers fit more like a men's size 8 1/2 or, at most, a men's size 9.First few times wearing them I had to force my toes up into the top of the slipper.  Which, was SO not comfortable but the slippers stayed on even though they felt a big snug.I've now had these slippers for a few weeks and they still aren't as comfortable for my toes as I would like.I find myself taking them off a lot, merely to wiggle my little piggies around.  I am sure the slippers will stretch out and be perfectly comfortable with a bit more wearing.  But, I also suspect I'll wear out the cloth of the slipper covering my toes faster than normal.So saying:  These are very nice slippers but if you wear a 9 1/2 or a solid 10 in men's?  You would do better ordering a size larger (rather than the 9 - 10 here).Here's hoping my review has helped you buy the most comfortable slippers for you!

author: Peter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2019
review_content: Instead of the usual flat cheap flip-flop slippers with flat plastic soles, I was on a quest for something better.I saw these Rockdove Men's Memory Foam Slippers listed as an Amazon Best Seller item.  Thousands of people bought them and rated them above four stars.  They're not kidding.  These slippers are great!First off, they're Memory Foam and your feet immediately feel the difference once you wear them when new.  The cushioning is better and softer than even expensive outdoor sneakers with air, gel, or Memory Foam inside.  The entire bottom is made of Memory Foam, not just Foam for the toes, arch, or the heel, so you get full foot support.  The thick layered comfort lasts for months.The top fabric is thick and strong; it wraps nicely around the feet, and adds a degree of warmth (especially in the winter) unrivaled by many other half-open slipper brands.  The dark colors prevent stains and dirt from discoloring the fabric.The rubber soles have grooves although I wouldn't say they're for grip for hiking on trails.  The soles work best on carpet and do not leave behind black scuff marks or deposit dirt.  I don't wear these slippers outside; I only wear them indoors.  Do note that wiping the black rubber soles will leave behind black color on the paper towel so I don't advise wearing these slippers on wet surfaces.  But the soles can indeed be wiped clean on the occasion you do step outside.Eventually, the top fabric covering will lose its tightness and expand to the point that it's no longer warm and the Memory Foam will get flatter. These occurrences will probably happen before the rubber soles wear out so that's when it might be time to replace the slippers.One disadvantage of these slippers is that when walking on tile or hardwood flooring, they tend to clop like a horse trotting down a cobblestone street.  This clopping noise can wake people up at night when going to the bathroom or kitchen.  These aren't silent slippers on hard surfaces because the black soles are made of hard rubber.  But inside a house with carpet, these Memory Foam Slippers are excellent for everyday use.
title: I can see why that this is an Amazon Best Seller Item

review_content: Was drawn to these because memory foam soles have made for some of the comfiest shoes I've found in the last few years, I liked the available colours and the price was good. author: Nick C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019
review_content: I like the material, not crazy warm or too thin. I like the perfect amount of firmness. The color is nice but not overbearing (I got grey/blue). BUT if you have wide feet go up at least a half size! I am a true 10.5 in length but most of my entire life have purchased 11's due to having wide, flat, feet. I was going to do the same thing here until I started reading MULTIPLE reviews stating that doing so would be a bad idea and to loose....well let's just say that immediately after putting these on I regretted listening to those because the these 10.5's are nearly cutting off my circulation and either bending my toe or my heel is hanging off. Do yourself a favor and just get a half size up regardless unless you're the kind of person who wants your foot hanging out. Other than that they're perfect for the money.
title: Get a half size bigger!

author: Dr. Nemo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019
review_content: Great for the winter! I bought these as I needed a slipper that was warm and I felt would last awhile. The colors are bright, and the slipper is easy to clean. Good traction outside as well.Biggest downside is that the heel and arch support are horrendous. My left ankle is ultra tight and sore after a day with these on around the house. In those cases, I just go back to my Crocs that I have had for several years. Plus those support my feet all day and night. Now those are buy-it-for-life slippers!Back to the Rockwells though. Overall they are okay. The lack of any support means that for me in particular, the overall comfort level is very much dismal towards the amount of pain I know I will be in after a few hours of use with them. Wearing socks doesn't help either. The "memory foam" within them is probably the worst I have felt in ages.Rating overall: 4/10.
title: Warm, but killer on the ankle.....

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2019
review_content: Nice colors, my husband really likes them
title: comfy house slippers

author: R. Juran
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
review_content: I wanted a comfy pair of house shoes and found these after a week or so of reading reviews and comparing prices.  I had a pair of Deerfoams from Costco that I got barely a year out of before the sole completely tore apart on both shoes.  I wanted something that breathed better as well since the Deerfoams cause my feet to sweat.I saw these and decided to give them a try.  I wanted memory foam but didn't want a full slip on shoe.  These are house slippers only and I spent a lot of time on my feet at work and have plantar fasciitis issues from an old injury.  While these don't have any arch support, they are insanely comfortable.Have walked around in them for a day ao far, they go on and off easily, my feet aren't swampy, and they are really comfortable.  The only draw back is the back doesn't catch the heel very well so they act a bit more like flip flops than a slipper.I will update on longevity and as they break in any issues that arise.
title: First steps.....so comfy

author: M Conn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2018
review_content: First off, these slippers are a bit small. Depending on the brand I wear a 10.5 or 11, so I ordered the 11-12 size. They barely fit and are a bit too snug for comfort.Next, the slippers themselves. The cushioning is great. Very soft. I don't know how long it will hold up before losing its support, but right now the cushioning is very nice. The material that is on the outside of the slipper, however, is a lint magnet. When taking these out of the bag they were covered in little threads and stuff. I brushed that off and just assumed it was a product of manufacturing. Wearing them around the house for a few hours, however, they are again covered in dust, lint, and threads. I have no idea where it's coming from since most of our floors are either ceramic or wood and are cleaned regularly, but these slippers collect a lot of lint.Next is the sole material. The sole isn't a soft rubber but instead is a harder plastic-y feel. Like I mentioned, most of our floors are either ceramic or wood, and these soles are pretty slick on those surfaces. Not skating-rink slick, but slick enough that you want to use a little caution.Overall, for the price I don't suppose they are bad. That said, I won't be purchasing them again.
title: Meh.

author: ubergoober
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2019
review_content: I think the only thing these have going for them is that they look nice. The memory foam..? Well, they were "squishy" when I got them, but after only a couple weeks there was nothing. Other reviews have noted the same thing. Not even sure it's even memory foam. Probably just cheap Chinese foam, but I've not cut them open to find out (maybe I will when I find a new pair of slippers). I have hardwood and concrete floors, and as odd as it sounds, walking on those floors with these on after the "memory foam" is toast is actually worse than being barefoot. The soul on these are also so thin that it's the same thing. I can't even walk out in my gravel driveway to get my Amazon packages without feeling every rock.I'm on the search again for slippers that actually have a padding that can stand up longer than a couple weeks.
title: Nope, still looking for good slippers

author: WickedVerve
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2018
review_content: It began quite nicely: nifty design, snug, cozy slippers.  However, the honeymoon is over.The memory foam has, as many have mentioned in other reviews, collapsed.  As I am not stout, this was disappointing.  More disappointing, though, was the large fracture that developed in the plastic sole - while my photo nicely shows the big gash, what it doesn't show as well is the consistent cracking of the plastic around the edge around almost the entire slipper.  Almost as though the plastic wasn't tested to hold up to daily use (maybe an hour per day).If this had happened one year in I would say I got my money's worth.  In this case I cannot.
title: Are these only supposed to last three months?

author: Patrick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
review_content: These run a bit small for sure. That wasnt the only the thing I wasnt happy about. They were only worn a few times (with socks!) but really quickly started to smell. They didnt really smell the way you would expect stinky shoes to smell, it was really strange. I was pleased with being able to just throw them in the washer and get rid of it. Unfortunately, it came back again. On top of that, they were just generally uncomfortable. Would not buy again. I bought them to be disposable, so in that respect they worked perfectly, other than that they were kind of merp
title: Would not buy again

author: RyanJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
review_content: I know this poor review is just a drop in the bucket of their overwhelmingly positive reviews.  I have but one vote among the 20k+ and average 4.5 stars.  However... I'm leaving this note for anyone that might read it.I bought these slippers on a lightning deal in February.  They were 4-5 stars for the first week. I really liked them.  However, over the next few weeks, they flattened out just like any cheap pair of slippers do.  Finally, less than 2 months later, one of the slippers split up the side, so I contacted their customer service.It took 3 emails to them over 2 weeks before they answered, and only when I mentioned that I would reflect my experience so far in a seller/product review.At first, they told me to "go through Amazon for all after-sale inquiries" which is incorrect, since Amazon only handles returns within their standard window.  When I referenced the part of the product description that says "...24/7 US-based support team ready to take care of all your after-sale needs..." They were quick to say that they evaluated my situation and were denying me any support.  Their wording was spiteful which was very much unappreciated.  A pair of slippers with 20k+ reviews should last more than 2 months.I liked the slippers at first... but they wore out quickly and finally split open... then the RockDove customer service had absolutely no remorse or support for their own product.  Apparently 20k other people have not had the same issue that I did.  Or, they left positive feedback within the first week of wearing their slippers, which is far more likely.If you buy these slippers... keep track of your return window from Amazon, and check them over for any rips/tears in time to return them.  Otherwise, you will be throwing them away because you'll get no support from their customer support team.
title: Comfortable for 1 week, split after 2 months, apathetic customer service would not replace them

author: Tucker Chapin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020
review_content: Out of the box, the only complaint I have about these is that they are oversized. Because of the memory foam, when you first slide your foot into them they might feel snug and comfortable but even within your first use of them the foam will compress and your foot will no longer stay in them easily and they will feel two or three sizes too large. I would recommend sizing down.However, there are much more critical issues.The interior cloth becomes pretty irredeemably stained and they look permanently dirty after a few months simply from dust/skin accumulation. Repeated washings and light stain removers haven't done anything to resolve this and I would be hesitant to use anything stronger given the rubber soles and the intense colors.  I tended to only wear these in the mornings after sliding out of bed and to/from the shower: it's not like I was coming back from romping in mud. I got the black/green colorway, but given that all the interior colors are light I believe its a fair assumption that it applies to all colors.The foam becomes very much "un-foamy" after only a short time. After a few months of daily use, the foam really does have a memory and just becomes thin padding between your foot and the sole/upper. They are still relatively comfortable, but not due to the foam and certainly nowhere near as comfortable as the first time you slip them on.And lastly: the flaw that prompted me to write this and toss them in the trash. Those would all be relatively forgivable and just chalked up to wear. But after just under a year the lip of the sole started to crack. It was only on one side and not under my foot so I wasn't too concerned. I mostly assumed I just wore them in weirdly. But today I was cleaning and noticing this crumbly black dirt all over my floors and it kept reappearing no matter how frequently I swept it up. I eventually realized it was the sole of the slippers. Barely over a year of use and the sole of one of the slippers has completely cracked and broken to the point that it's now crumbling and disintegrating.These could be fantastic slippers if they behaved the way they did when you slip them on. But sadly they are not and you'd be better off with a pair that's half the price that will probably last just as long.
title: Great out of the box, downhill fast

author: Avery
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018
review_content: My foot size is 11.5 US Men's size.  I got the 11-12 size and the base of the slipper fits my foot base just right.  The slippers are very comfortable and warm, I enjoy using them every day on my chilly tile floors.  Sometimes I wear socks if it's really cold, but I would not describe these as cold at all for indoor use.  I haven't seen any of the quality issues others have posted.  Mine came out of the box looking good and have held up well.  I've used them for a little over a month and they're still in new condition even with a few quick excursions outside on the concrete and grass.  I really only have one complaint and that is that they want to slip off my feet if I don't curl my toes and walk slightly shuffling.  It's not terrible, but I do have to be mindful when walking in them to keep them on my feet... but I guess that's why they call them slippers right!?!  I don't know, I think they could have a little taller rear or tighter top band to hold your foot better.  Overall I like them and am glad I have them, just if they held on a little tighter they would be perfect then.
title: Warm, but loose

author: ACAR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
review_content: I have wide feet and gave up trying to find leather slippers that aren't too tight.  These soft slippers easily form around my foot and are comfortable.  The outer soles appear durable enough for walking garbage cans down the driveway but the open back invites debris underfoot.  There's not much support underfoot so these slippers are designed for indoor use almost exclusively.  I prefer to use boat shoes for slippers because they're more useful outside but I'll keep an old pair of running shoes near the door and change into them as needed.Update: downgraded to 1 star.  What little padding/support there had been is now completely gone after only one month.  Had to discontinue use because of knee pain.  These slippers may be OK on carpeted floors but for hardwood or tile they are like walking barefoot.Update:  needed a Wide slipper so I did what I should have done initially - visited LLBean, looked at their products but did not buy, waited a few days and a 25% off coupon arrived in my email (LLBean has me on-file) and bought a pair of their handsewn Camp Mocs in 9.5 EE which fit perfectly.  Note; my dress shoe size is 9E.  Leather costs more than foam but I'll probably get at least 3 years use from the Camp Mocs.
title: Zero padding/support

author: Angela Johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2018
review_content: I bought these for my husband and I and i love that they are machine washable but I wish they were a little more "cushy." I wanted to stop wearing shoes in the house and I also need cushion under my feet in our home that has a lot of hardwood floors. With achy joints and neuropathy, having a good cushion under my feet all day is the difference between having no pain at the end of the day or be so painful I have a hard time sleeping.These slippers work but not for being on my feet all day in my house when I'm cooking, etc.They are a bit loose on the fit so they are really easy to wear with socks.Would I buy them again? Yes.But they aren't something I can wear for more than a couple of hours before having to wear my tennis shoes to provide more cushion.I know this may sound "whiny" but when you have neuropathy (nerve pain in your feet) I'm pretty particular about what works and what doesn't. :)
title: Almost perfect

author: Richy Dingo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019
review_content: So I've had these for something like 3 months and use them only occasionally.Why have I marked these slippers as 1 star? I'm normally more forgiving than that but simply put it's because the fundamental selling point of these slippers - memory foam - that rapidly compacts and no longer does its job. True that when you first wear them, they do indeed appear comfortable (in a cushioned way, not in a supportive way - no arch support here), however shortly afterwards they will compact and then you'll find zero cushioning for your heels. No I don't wear these 24 hours a day, no I haven't gotten them wet, and no I don't weigh 1000lbs.Simply put a bad choice of materials and not up to the job so don't buy them.Other things.I chose the fetching blue with yellow inner. Looks nice but they will look dirty fast.All in all these are a form over function pair of slippers that you will be throwing away within 3 months.Dingo
title: Poorly designed - Memory Foam will fail

author: PlaysWithFire
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2019
review_content: I always wear a size 9 shoe and the Medium fits me perfectly. They are cozy and comfortable. The rubber soles have a decent grip and I don't worry about wearing them into the basement or stepping outside the front door. I am often tempted to buy high-end products, but I bought two of the RockDoves instead. This cost me half as much or less versus some high-end options, and I feel it was a good decision. I'm never without slippers even for a short time. I wear each pair for two weeks, put them through the washing machine and lay them out to dry while I switch to the other pair. The memory foam insoles do flatten a bit with use, but they rebound after washing. It has been too short a time to say much about durability, but each pair is still 100% after a few months. I think I will get a lot of use out of them. For the price, I can readily recommend this product.
title: Functional and a Good Value

author: Ireview4U
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020
review_content: After doing the usual looking around, I opted for these. I am happy to say they have been excellent so far for me. As soon as I get home from work, I get out of my work shoes & pop these on. So I wear them for a couple hours or more a day. They have been holding up perfectly. They are very comfy. The memory foam has not given up on me at all, which from other reviews, had me worried. I wear these with socks on & without. Haven't had any issues either way. The slippers wi) keep your toes warm, if that's your thing. I definitely recommend these!
title: Very comfy, excellent memory foam slippers.

author: Jay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2017
review_content: My only complaint is when I walk on hard flooring in my house (The bathroom, Kitchen and my deck) the soles are a bit noisy like I'm wearing hard dress shoes like you would wear with a tuxedo. Other then that these are easily the most comfortable slippers I've ever owned. they're light and what I like most of all is they are very breathable. Most other slippers I've owned make my feet feel like they're in an oven after a while these are the first pair of slippers I've ever had that I actually leave them on while I'm watching TV or just lounging around. These keep my feet warm but not uncomfortably hot. You will not find a better pair of slippers for 20 bucks.
title: Excellent and the price is nice

author: sifelaver
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2017
review_content: Extremely comfortable (thank you memory foam) but somewhat larger than expected. I wear a size 10 1/2 in sneakers, and a size 10 in dress shoes - both with   Dr. Scholl's Custom Fit Orthotic Inserts, CF 130          . This is a size 9-10 and I have about a half inch of heel room. Not a big deal for slippers but worth noting. I'd be hesitant to try the next size down, 7-8.Also not specific to these slippers but many slippers out there in general - I'd prefer a heel backing rather than the clog format. I just feel more snug and cozy that way, and they are less slip-offy, so to speak.
title: Super comfortable!

author: D. Aks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2018
review_content: When I got my husband these slippers, he just kind of stared at them in disgust.  "House slippers??  I don't need those!"  He's a real manly man who just likes to walk around in socks or bare feet.  After a couple weeks though I noticed that he had started wearing them....I said, "Wait, I thought you didn't like them?"  He told me actually had started to really get used to them and found them comfortable.  He literally has never had an interest in house slippers in his life and he is VERY picky about craftsmanship (he builds things) and is so critical.  So the fact that he started wearing them is a real testament to these slippers.Now he ALWAYS wears these in the house!  When he can't find them he gets really annoyed.  I'll admit it, for awhile I found them so comfortable I started wearing them and neglecting my own slippers (cute but they were so hot).  Eventually, I bought my own women's pair.  The great thing about this brand is that they make a million different colors for both men and women.  Before you buy make sure you look at what they sell and check out ALL of the different styles.  They also release new styles every season.The only issue is that they were definitely a bit large, and I ordered his exact size shoe.  And they are definitely too large.  But he is not very picky and even though I offered to exchange them or get a different pair he refused.  The best thing about these slippers are the amazing value...I have spent so much money on slippers in my life, way expensive and even cheaper than these and nothing has matched up to these. They are durable, comfortable, and look expensive.  The only reason I didn't buy myself a pair right away is because I'm a slipper snob and thought there was no way I'd be happy with a pair of such inexpensive slippers!  Wow, I could not be more wrong.  These are the greatest and I will be be buying more colors and styles.
title: My picky, slipper-hating husband loves them!  They do run large though.

author: The Bruce
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2020
review_content: I knew before ordering that I didn't like this style of slipper, but I wanted to give them a chance because of the claims made about the sole. Now, after having them for a year, I can say two things: one, order a size smaller than you normally wear, because they fit quite large; two, they "expand" as you wear them & so end up fitting even more loosely than they did when you first bought them. Because of the "half foot" style, all this will cause them to fall off your feet very easily, even just normally walking around the house.On the bright side, they are high quality; after a year of wearing them constantly, they are still in excellent condition. If you like this style of slipper, & order them 1 size smaller, you will probably like these slippers a lot, which is why I give them 5 stars even though I don't personally like them.  I'll be getting a new pair of slippers soon & it won't be this style, but I do recommend these slippers to anyone who likes the slip-on "half foot" kind.
title: I should have known better

author: J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
review_content: Overall, I like them.When i first bought them, the slippers were almost too-snug... but over time, they started to fit. Then over MORE time, they started to get too loose. Currently they are super loose, but still stay on my feet as long as i don't go kicking my feet around. The bottoms of the slippers are definitely a hard plastic or something (standard shoe-type i'd think) and have endured well considering i wear them daily for most the day. The inside isn't uncomfortable, but since it lost the snug fit feeling, they aren't like, comfy or anything. They just do their slipper job protecting my feet from crap i've procrastinated vacuuming up or spills in the kitchen etc.Despite these complaints, they are still quite solid and after wearing them daily for almost 8 months, I say i've gotten my 25$ or whatever they were worth.
title: They do their job, though they've gotten pretty

author: C. Solomon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
review_content: Unfortunately they don't offer a US Men's 10-11. The 9-10 is too small. I had to return it because my heel rested on the raised heel of the slipper when I walked, and this was uncomfortable. I won't buy again because (1) I expect that the US Men's 11-12 will be too large, and (2) there was really nothing special about this slipper. It has a flat bottom without any arch support, and doesn't feel very warm and cozy. My feet run narrow and the slipper seems rather wide letting a lot of cold air in around the sides. Don't get me wrong. This isn't a bad product. Its just very average an didn't fit well on my own feet.At the time of this posting this product has almost 5000 reviews, or about 20X the number of reviews of other leading men's slippers. This doesn't make sense for what is clearly a very middle of the road typical slipper. In fact I had to try accessing this product page a few different ways before Amazon would even let me post this review.  Amazon's site reported "Sorry, we are unable to accept reviews for this product. This product has limitations on submitting reviews. There can be a number of reasons for this, including unusual reviewing activity."I am a very loyal Amazon customer, but I disappointing in them that they did NOT warn me when I purchased these slippers that the reviews on this product may be suspicious!  Fakespot.com gives this product an A, so I reported this to their customer support. Their algorithms may need some special tuning for what is going on with this specific slipper and its Amazon reviews.
title: US Men Size 9-10 Too Small for US Men's 10.5 feet + Suspicious Reviews

author: NAVET
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2020
review_content: I am commenting on these because my first pair my wife bought as a Christmas gift. At first I did not like the fit because they were a little tight. So I kind of said thank you and put them in the pile. I go through shoes like this fast as I’m disabled and wear them almost all the time, since I’m at home. Anyway, I ran through my last comfortable pair and found these and figured I’d see if they needed to be worn a day or two to fit right. Well that is all it took as they fit perfect now. They are very comfortable and durable considering how I use them. Yes I do yard work in them and wash the car, etc. So they have gotten wet and dirty a lot. That pair I still have, but they are a little tattered now. So I bought another pair waiting for the first pair to tear or fall apart in washing. So I’ll have a spare now and when they go on sale I’ll buy another backup. I wear 10.5 and that’s what I bought. Trying the European 10 or 11 thing has never worked for me in any shoe, so if a 10.5 is not available I don’t buy.
title: Wear a day or two then comment

author: Points Unknown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
review_content: Given the abundance of time I spend around the house in a COVID quarantine world, I needed a nice pair of house slippers. I have spent the last week wearing these 12- 16 hours a day and I have to say they are quite comfortable, keep my feet warm (but not too warm), and fit great. Overall a great value and I am very happy with my purchase.My old slippers built up a lot of static electricity on the carpet - so much that I was always shocking myself. These do not have that problem (must be something with the sole material, but nothing has shocked me yet!). So that is a huge plus for these.
title: Perfect for long days at the house in quarantine

author: Anomaly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
review_content: I purchased these in October 2019, thinking that I was buying a quality product which could handle light outdoor wear and general indoor use. For the price, I expected something which would last at least a full year. Unfortunately, that's not the case.When I first received my slippers, I loved them! They looked nice and were very comfortable. Within a couple weeks, the foam had permanently worn down to a useless, thin liner, making the slippers entirely too large despite buying the right size. I still wore them and still tried to take care of them, but the memory foam kept breaking down further until it was bunched up under my toes and the outsole wore down very quickly despite being primarily used indoors on carpeted and vinyl tiled flooring - nothing particularly harsh.They've been worn indoors and on the porch, not in any harsh conditions, and only washed on delicate cycle when they get a little dirty from spills etc. - so very rarely. Unfortunately, the bottoms have already work slick in places and have now developed a hole from wearing down too far in one side. They're now officially garbage after only about six months!I tried contacting the email address as indicated on the product tag, explaining the issue and asking for assistance via their alleged refunds and returns policy. ("We gladly accept all reasonable requests for a return or refund, so please contact us anytime you're unhappy with your slippers, regardless of how long they've been worn. In most cases, we'll offer you a replacement or refund without asking you to send anything back.") But it's been a few weeks and I haven't received any kind of response, not even an automated one, so I doubt I'll get any response.I'm deeply disappointed with the lack of quality, especially since I had hoped I'd finally found some good slippers. Next time, I'll just buy cheap ones to last a few months since these didn't last any longer at twice the price.
title: Too Loose, Weak Foam, Poor Quality

author: Cindy Tesch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2020
review_content: I bought these for my son, he just received them 3 days ago. This is a little early to give a TRUE review. He is almost 16 and loves them. His shoe size is 8, so I had a hard time choosing which size to purchase. A whole shoe size is a big difference, which way do you go???I purchased the 9-10 size, the slippers are a little big, but much better than too small!!! I hope this helps when you’re choosing the size.
title: If you’re on the latter size, go a size up.

author: bousozoku
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020
review_content: I appreciate that these slippers are made in the USA.  That's probably why they cost about double what I would expect to pay for them.  (I have a pair of Dearfoams for $12.99 that are falling apart but are comfortable.)I've only had them for a single day.  When I first put my feet into them, I thought that they would be amazing.  That wore off within a few minutes.The house where I live has hard tile and my feet have had issues with that hard surface.  I'd be fine with running shoes, but shoes aren't allowed to be worn in the house, for fear of ruining what little carpeting exists.The padding of the slippers is probably 25% of what's actually needed and the slippers would probably be double the price to be comfortable. I'd be willing to try those slippers.I only expected a bit more than I got, so I'm not incredibly disappointed.
title: They're comfortable for the first few minutes

author: -n
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2020
review_content: I'm so weary of trying to find good slippers.  I wanted a slipper that I can leave by the back door for quick trips to the trash, out to the car to fetch something, grabbing some firewood.  They need to be water proof.  It rains here.  A lot.I purchased and tossed numerous pairs over the last 2 or 3 years.These come closest to perfect for me and, depending on your size, they may be perfect for you.  They are well constructed and don't get soaking wet walking a few steps in the grass.My only issue is the size.  I'm an 11.  The options were 10.5 or 11/12.  I went for the 11/12 and they are a bit big.  Walking up the slight rise in my side yard they will just slip right off.-n
title: Very good quality.  TRULY water resitant.  Wish they had better size options.

author: Nathan Arthur
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2020
review_content: I gave these three stars because they're acceptable if your only goal is "cheap slippers". But I tried two sizes, based on reading other reviews and Q&A here, for my standard-size-12 feet, and neither works. I started with the 13-14 and they were just too loose; they felt like they were falling off as I walked. So I went to the 11-12, and they aren't as loose - but they are still a bit loose - but more important, they aren't long enough. The back edge of the upper is more under my heel than behind it, which makes walking uncomfortable. It's worse if I put socks on. The "best" case is if I take off my socks and cram my toes into the front - then the heel isn't so bad, but the toes are crammed (and the mid-section is still too loose).I've seen comments from the seller about the sizes being based on standard shoe sizes, but that doesn't matter - without a real heel, there's nothing holding it snugly on the foot. So then they should adjust the width / upper to hold better - and they haven't. These just aren't designed to be walked in comfortably, regardless of what size they claim to be.I don't really want to return these again, and with COVID shipping delays, getting a better pair seems like a challenge, so I plan to keep these. author: Dustin F
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020
review_content: Are these the most luxurious slippers I've ever been exposed to? No.Are they comfy as hell and better than walking on hardwood floors in the winter? author: JMMorton

author: Tiki Tom

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2018
review_content: The first time I put these on they felt great but after a week or two most of the memory foam had collapsed in the regular areas, the ball and heel of the foot. In the heel there is maybe a quarter inch of rubber and foam left. It started with double that or more. After doing some research, this is pretty much par for the course for memory foam. Constant compression combined with heat will break down the memory aspect of the foam, leaving your with a foot shaped impression in your slippers. Given that information, I am not sure why memory foam is used in shoes at all. I have high arches so the support in these slippers falling so quickly is a real disappointment. That said they do support better than other slippers, I bought an expensive pair from a well known company, at the End of the Lands, that turned out to be little more than a neatly trimmed leather sock with faux fur lining. These are better than those.

author: M M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2019
review_content: I've gotten a bit more than I paid for.They aren't shockingly comfortable,  the sole cushioning is thin enough that I wouldn't want to walk on pavement in them all day, but for the twenty I paid for them, I'm surprised they've lasted as many wash cycles as they have.I'm sure they won't last forever, but they've already surpassed the point where I've decided I'll buy them again if and when they croak. review_content: Got these to use as house slippers, and while they are warm and well insulated, they don't fit or stay on very well. If you have stairs in your home do not attempt to take them with these on your feet. They come off very easy as you are taking each step, and can potentially trip you up as they did to me. I finally just threw them away after I recently attempted to take 2 steps up to my front door, and one of them cam off my foot midstep causing me to fall forward, springing my wrist.I would not recommend these to anyone given how terribly they fit. I will state that they are comfortable and warm for colder times, but that is really their only appeal. Actually walking in them is a chore.
title: Can be a hazard.

author: Gangsta Real
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020
review_content: TIP: when these arrived, the thread on the sole was sticking out a bit in a couple places, as seen in my first two photos. My tip is to hold down the loose part of the thread and place a little Krazy Glue on it so it doesn’t unravel further (see my last photo, which has the Krazy Glue on it.)Also, it may be because I’ve never owned slippers before and I didn’t know what to expect, but even after I’ve stretched these out a bit, they always feel like they’re going to fly off my feet when I walking. Is that normal for slippers? The back heal is almost non-existent and I feel I have to curl my toes a bit with every step to hold them on. My shoe size is 9.5; and I bought size 9-10 and they fit
title: TIP for loose thread, and review.

author: JCS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020
review_content: After about a week of wearing these, they're about what I expected. I work from home so I've been living in these day and night, so they've gotten some miles on them already. The padding is decent. It will definitely flatten out relatively quick, but so have ones I've paid much more for. It has a decent depth of padding though. Solid sole. The seems have held up with lots of inside and outside wearing. For the price, it's a good slipper.
title: Good slipper for what you pay

author: Canavan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018
review_content: I bought these slippers recently to replace an older pair that had served me well for many years, but which had worn out. Those slippers were unfortunately no longer available from their manufacturer, so I tried the RockDove slippers. In terms of fit and feel they were reasonable/acceptable. I don’t particularly care for the color, but in this instance that’s not a very big factor in my assessment of product quality. The really HUGE downside with these slippers is their longevity. A single washing (that followed product instructions) and both slippers started to fall apart, splitting open along a seam at the back. It doesn’t matter how great the product is in all other ways; if it doesn’t last more than a few months, it’s a failure.
title: Product started to fall apart after a single washing

author: Amy C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2017
review_content: Bought for husband who wears a 10 to 10 ½ in shoes and boots. They are wide through the toe and up to the ankle which he said is comfortable but they are a little long. He doesn't mind since he can wear heavier socks with them in winter.Since he does have a problem with foot sweat and stinky, he's now putting them on right away when he gets home and its easier than having to wash his feet and change into new socks so we both really like that part!Overall a good mens slipper.
title: Good slipper for the guys

author: Michael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
review_content: I wear a size 12 shoe. The size 11-12 slipper was a little small, but I decided to keep it since I figured it would stretch a bit from use. The fact that these are backless really bothers me, they fall off quite often as there's nothing to keep them on your feet. They're comfortable, but after wearing them for about two weeks the soles have completely flattened out in the heel, making these very unsupportive. I still wear them to keep my feet warm if I'm not standing a lot, but if I'm spending a lot of time on my feet I think I'll just wear real shoes for the support. I do wish I had returned them for the larger size, as they never really stretched enough to fit properly.
title: Comfy for a while.

author: Michael H. Rolbeck
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
review_content: I purchased these slippers almost 5 months ago and for the money they were pretty good while they lasted.  However, after about 3 months I experienced the same problem as other reviewers.  The stitching and the soles are still OK, but the memory foam broke down.  As a result they become, in effect, a larger size which causes them to come off your feet at inopportune times.  Worst case scenario this instability can be a trip hazard however, mostly it’s frustrating to continually retrieve a slipper that has come off from backward or sideways movement.  I must emphasize that I had this problem only after the memory foam no longer held the slipper on my feet.  I’m not sure what the intended service life of these slippers is and they may be OK for light minimum use but they didn’t work for me.  My wife got a pair at the same time and had the same problem.
title: Great Price But They Don't Last Long

author: Joseph virgona
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2019
review_content: I must say that these slippers are great. At first I ordered a size to big because I figured it's usually safer that way with slippers so your heal isn't hanging half way out and it will be easier to just slide right in them, but when I got them I was dissapointed because they were too easy to slide into that my foot would just slide out so I contacted the seller and they shipped out a new pair with my correct(exact) size and at no extra cost and without a return. Which helped out major because I was in a surgery and am now in recovery enjoying slippers everyday. Two pieces of advice I can offer. One is order your actual size your foot will fit perfectly. And number two don't expect to wear these outside while walking in rocks or anything because u will feel them. These are great slippers and the seller is extrodinary and I appreciate they're help through this tough surgery.
title: Great product great service

author: A.cook
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2018
review_content: I disliked this product , not as advertised. They are very loose fitting, even in your correct size and with zero support. The memory foam is only comfortable for the first few minutes then flattens out. It felt like I was walking on a flat surface with no support. I would not recommend walking outside due to slipper sole being very thin and you feel everything you walk on. I do not recommend this product. I would have returned the product if I hadn't walked outside in the slipper and got it dirty. Very dissatisfied for the money spent, I felt the product did not live up to the description.
title: Listen more to negative reviews

author: Wo0tus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
review_content: This is the second pair of Rockport slippers I've bought, and I couldn't be happier. The first pair I bought took a bit shy of a full year of daily wear before they starting showing signs of needing replacing. I expect I'll very likely get close to a year out of these as well.These slippers are cozy and plush! It's almost as if you feet breath a sign of relief upon first putting these on. the memory foam bed (or insole/whatever name you want to call it) in the slippers hugs your feet, and rebounds pretty darn well. It took the previous pair I bought about 3 months before the insole/bed stopped rebounding fully and had more of a indentation of my foot. Regardless they were still very comfortable even after you could clearly see the shape of my foot in the bed, they just didn't "hug" my feet as aggressively after that.I really do love these slippers, and i'm very likely to buy another pair of rockports when I finally grind this pair into the ground.
title: Cozy slippers that will give you happy feet

author: MLT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2019
review_content: My foot size to the toes is 11 1/2.My foot size to the ball of my foot (the proper size point) is 11 1/2.That hasn't changed since I was 13 years old and feet don't get appreciably longer as you age.I ordered the size 13-14 just to be on the safe side and they arrived today.I can, just barely, shove my feet in them.They're too narrow by far.They're not more than an honest size 11 (US) .I'm likely not going to return them because I can do a bit of surgery to them and make them work, but if you really must buy these, but at least two full sizes larger than you think you need.
title: Incredibly poor sizing.

author: Beantown Jim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2019
review_content: These slippers are comfy as heck and will appeal to almost anyone.  They're easy slip on or off and have just enough grip on the floor to avoid that fall we all fear.  The only problem with mine was the size.  I had gotten slippers my size from another vendor and they were too small, so I upped the size for these and now had ones too large.  Apparently these size true to form, unlike most others, and thus if you do as most people do and get the next size up in order to be comfortable (width-wise) you will have loose fitting slippers.
title: Comfy, but get the size right

author: John
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2020
review_content: These are literally the worst slippers I've ever worn or purchased and for the price, they suck. I use them for playing VR games to keep quiet and distribute pressure on my feet, and they are thin, erode quickly and are prone to being soaked in disgusting sweat.I wouldn't recommend these if you have sweaty feet, are actively walking around and need to walk up stairs. I severely stubbed my toes walking up stairs with these and there is no toe guard support. Be careful and don't hurt yourself.That's not a fault of the manufacturer but my fault. The point still stands, there are better and safer slippers out there. Do more research.
title: Quickly becomes drenched in sweat, erodes quickly.  Don't buy this garbage

author: Hank
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
review_content: Very satisfied with these slippers.  Have had them for about two weeks and they have held up well, but then I only wear them in the evening after my shower and in the morning before my workout.  I do like the memory foam insoles and these slippers keep my feet warm.  I wear size eleven WIDE shoe.  With my experiences with footwear, I knew that to purchase a slipper in the 11-12 range MEDIUM width, would be a mistake.  So, I went with the extra large slipper.  It is about 3/4 inch too long (I wear socks), but the uppers are tight enough to cling to my feet.  Although the heels drag a little, the slippers do not feel that they are going to fall off.  If the sellers had offered a WIDE size, I would have probably purchased the smaller slippers.  Still, I am very satisfied with my purchase.
title: RockDove Men's Two-Tone Memory Foam Slippers

author: James Absey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
review_content: I bought these about 2 years ago and normally I wouldn't complain, if i had worn these a lot.  But I didn't wear them very often at all.  I bought them to wear in our motorhome.  which has been minimal this last year .  They fit tight at first, but opened up with wear.  Then about 3 months ago the soles started to separate from the uppers, they got worse every time I wore them.  now the soles are almost completely off and I had to throw them away as being worthless.  I am wearing another pair that are similar from Isotoner, these slippers are 5 years old and they are the ones i wear most often.  They are still holding up and are so comfortable.  You get what you pay for kind of applies.
title: They were good until they weren't !

author: K. Nunez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020
review_content: Winters can be long in our area if the Midwest and my husband, originally from San Jose, CA, complains a lot about how cold he is. I've told him the last couple years that slippers would help him out but he would say "No, I don't need them" or "They aren't going to help." Well, we got a nice Amazon gift card for Christmas and before he knew it I shopped for slippers for him and found these. He comes home from work and slippers get put on right away. He wakes up in the morning and puts his slippers on. I ask him "So, how are you doing?" And he'll answer with "I'm nice and warm because of my slippers." I'm so happy he's finally warm. Great slippers, great fit. He loves everything about them.
title: Most warm and comfy slippers for the man in your life

author: Slathered in Gravy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2018
review_content: These might be the first slippers I ever owned that didn't have the standard material that pills up and turns into little worn dust balls.  They're comfortable and made of the kind of material that wicks moisture away. They are a little 'slippery', so walking up and down stairs is a little tricky, a combination of the synthetic material and not having a back besides the heel.  But you probably already know that if you're buying them, and if you need something that stays on your foot there are other options. These slip on and off with ease and have been excellent around the house.They're probably not the warmest slippers out there, FYI.  That doesn't bother me, since our cold days aren't too cold, but it's something to consider if you're in the bitter winter areas.
title: Great "performance" slipper for mild winters

author: D. Ware
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021
review_content: Had high hopes for these. First, the memory foam is virtually nonexistent. Second, in order to get the right size, you can expect them to not stay on your foot. Color was good, but in a brief two months, they wore thin very fast and felt unsafe. So, in the trash they went. Replaced them with a better pair with better grip. Disappointing to say the least.
title: Terrible. Thrown in trash.

author: Paul
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
review_content: I was in dire need of new slippers and decided to get these.  At first I wasn't sure if they were fitting right but just like the card that comes attached to the slipper says "they tend to fit snug at first as the insoles take time to compress".  After wearing them for a week they are feeling like they fit my feet better, still snug but not too much.  I like them a lot.  They feel good on my feet.
title: Nice feeling slippers

author: Mahmahmonkey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2020
review_content: I'm one of these guys that tends to wear slippers outdoors because I'm too lazy to put shoes on. Don't expect to pick up the ladies in these bad boys, but if you want a durable product, they're not bad.
title: Slippers, they're not just for indoors anymore

author: K. W. Queen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
review_content: I liked these until I had to wash them. I tossed them in the washer, by themselves, on cold and the gentle cycle then air-dried them as the instructions said. I had to throw them away because after a couple of days of wear my feet were sore and walking in them was actually a little painful. Maybe someone else had a different experience washing them but that is my story.
title: I liked them until...

author: CA Dude
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2017
review_content: I’ve had these for less than a month, and only wear them occasionally some evenings, about 3 or 4 days a week. They were very comfy when just arrived, but now the memory foam is almost gone at the heel and they feel very flat. I’m 5'6" with slim build, so it's not like the product has been overly stressed. Most likely the foam is either too thin, or doesn't keep its form due to poor quality.On the outside they look great and the exterior materials appear of good quality, but it’s the stuff inside that matters for a slipper to be comfortable.
title: Foam loses memory after minimal wear.

author: bobby b

author: big daddy

I have never gave a review praising a product as I have. Have been wearing slippers for less than a month. Don't know the durability as of yet, will definitely purchase no matter how long it last!
title: Thank You RockDove!

author: Shawners
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
review_content: I really wanted to like these slippers. They look very nice and seem well made, except for the foot cushion. author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020
review_content: I wear size 10.5 shoe so I ordered the 10.5 and it fits perfectly. Very comfortable to wear. My only concern is they are warmer than expected. title: Feels great but a little warm

author: Karen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019
review_content: My 10 year old son requested some new slide on slippers last year for Christmas. title: These are top notch slippers for such a great price

author: Anonymous
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2020

title: Recommended!

author: Taylor Blake Harris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020
review_content: These slippers are comfortable, lightweight enough not to make your feet sweat, they look much better than your average pair of slippers and less like something your grandma would wear, and they are extremely affordable. It's obvious why these are the best selling slipper on Amazon. They may be too large for some though...I wear a size 13.5 US men's shoe in most cases, am 6'6" and have long, slender feet, so I'm probably on the "narrow" end of shoes that offer such a dimension, though I've never had to order a "narrow" variant of a shoe size to fit properly before. I ordered size 13's of this slipper since no 13.5 was available and it's definitely still on the larger, loosely fitting side. The length isn't far from being right even though there's still a bit of a gap between the back of the shoe's heel and my own, but the width is definitely too wide and something I would expect from ordering a shoe size advertised as "wide", creating a lot of horizontal wiggle when walking that occasionally requires a curl of the toes to the shoes from sliding off. If you have wide feet, these may be perfect for you, but I'd recommend most people to buy a size 1.5 smaller than they think they need.
title: The ideal pair of light slippers, but make sure to order a size 1.5 smaller than you need

author: Brian Hanes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020
review_content: After a slightly confused wasp crawled across my foot while I was using the restroom, and then finding a few more on different mornings meandering threateningly around the floor of my new home, two things became very clear. I needed to call an exterminator, and I needed to get some comfortable foot protection or I would never feel relaxed. Sure, I could wake up every day, lace up my Docs, and tromp around thoughtlessly smushing the little buggers until bed time, but that sounded like a hassle.The reviews on these seemed pretty solid, so I pulled the trigger. And called the exterminator.Couldn’t be happier. They’re super comfortable, fit right, and let me shuffle around the house without worry of surprise wasp stings.They’re kinda stylish too. Went with the grey/blue combo and am happy to report I haven’t gotten any funny looks when answering the door. They almost look like slip on walking shoes. Sketchers for staying in. The exterminator didn’t even notice I wasn’t wearing standard kicks.They are pretty warm, which is a bonus right now (mid-February), but might be an issue when the sun comes back.They seem solid enough to wear outside for things like checking the mail, but I haven’t tested that theory yet since I’d like to keep these clean and spiffy. Also they may protect from stepping on a wasp stinger, but I don’t think I’d tangle with a snake or bobcat while wearing these. Probably not suited for yard work either, but one can dream.A note on fit: I’ve seen some complaints here about sizing being too small. The slippers came with a note about breaking them in. When I first put them on they did feel pretty snug. Heel was in danger of falling out the back. I wore them for a couple days and everything relaxed. I’ve had them for a few weeks now and they’re amazing. Not too loose, and not too snug. I forget I have them on while conked out in the recliner. Love em.
title: Super comfy. And wasp proof. At least on the bottom.

author: Dudley Murray
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: These slippers are attractive and feel warm and cozy on the foot. However, the lack “support”, not from the slipper to the foot, but in the structure of the item itself. They are so wonderful when you sit still wearing them, and they fit the foot nucely, but when you walk with them, stop to pick up something, or kneel to reach underneath a cabinet, it lacks a firmness which holds it in place on the foot. I’m keeping them for lounging when I don’t need to be active in any other way, but if the wearer plans to be active around the house in any way, I would not recommend this slipper to them.
title: Not quite right ...

author: James Rodrigues

My feet, legs and hips hurt more when I don’t have these on.  I haven’t needed to clean or wash them yet, so I don’t know how well it stays together after that.
title: Helps with pain

author: Penn Name

I'm happy to have slippers that work finally.

author: SB

author: Narq

author: Shirley Erana

author: Ed in Ohio
